stories.text: A prediction: starting no later than 15 years from today and persisting for at least 3 years, more than half of the web's "legitimate" page views will consist of a machine-learning model scanning the page, then telling the user what the page says than will consists of the user interacting with the page directly. A "legitimate" page view is one in which a human user requests a particular page, then the page or the machine-learning model's description is downloaded over the internet to the computer on the network closest to the user.
